intro: Tetrapterys humilis var. stephaniana, commonly known as the Mexican dwarf mistletoe, is a parasitic plant that grows on various host trees in Mexico. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually green but can turn reddish during the growing season. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its berries are typically red or yellow and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. This species is notable for its role in the ecological interactions of its native habitats.
